title: RFC: datalad.save.subdataset config sections to define when/how to automagically establish subdatasets
body:
Initial use case is to automate per-month subdatasets generation for https://github.com/con/tinuous/ . ATM primarily for a use with `datalad run` (or `rerun`) where the underlying command populates some new directory worth placing into a subdataset (e.g. a new subject within a huge BIDS dataset etc)

I see this feature also potentially useful for addurls as a more flexible (than the `//` in the target filepath it currently supports) way to define when to create a new subdataset, and potentially later to be used for datalad-crawler.

```bash
[datalad.save.subdataset "allsubdstext2git"]
	regexes = ^[^/]*/
	cfg = text2git
```

there could be multiple such sections with custom `"names"` to provide most of the flexibility.

May be something like that is already achievable with the hooks somehow?

cons:
- this setting will reside only in the parent super-dataset and not propagate into subdatasets.  Coding/testing should be done so that behavior is well defined, e.g. if subdatasets define their own settings, they are respected as well and probably are in effect before super-dataset consideration (but that might be tricky)
